channel.title: Members on Intelligent Lighting Systems
channel.description: Recent content in Members on Intelligent Lighting Systems

item.title: Member 1
item.description: Jean-Paul Linnartz is Research Fellow with Philips Lighting and Professor at TU/e. His main research topic is Intelligent Lighting Systems and Optical Wireless Communication. Previously he was a Senior Director and Department Head at Philips Research in Eindhoven, the Netherlands. He authored many scientific papers about electronic watermarks and radio communications (OFDM, MC-CDMA, random access). He was a faculty member at the University of California at Berkeley and at Delft University of Technology.

item.title: Member 2
item.description: Anton Alexeev is a PhD candidate at Eindhoven University of Technology. His main research topic is LEDs compact modeling. He is involved in European Project Delphi4LED. Prior to the start of pursuing his PhD He obtained a Design and Technology of Instrumentation PdEng degree, and successfully finished three design projects in Momentive Performance Materials (USA), NXP, and Philips Lighting (The Netherlands). He received his Master degree in physics from Novosibirsk State University for investigation of hypersonic vehicles combustion chambers test methods.
